result.execSummary:
Brandon A. Hicks was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brandon A. Hicks was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A. Hicks

defendant.name: Hicks, Brandon A.
defendant.address: W3780 W. Water St, Sullivan, WI 53178

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From the State advising def has been picked up and transported to Alabama
Review hearing on July 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Fax confirmation of WOE to JESO

Case called at 1:15 pm
Defendant Brandon A. Hicks in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Service of Extradition Complaint admitted; reading waived; Court reviews allegations from Alabama.
Court reviews arrest warrant out of Alabama.
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that defendant would like to waive extradition.
recess: 1:19 pm
reconvene: 1:26 pm
Defendant and Attorney Zarwell appear in person in court.
The Court finds that the video connection was sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews defendant's rights to extradition warrant and habeaus corpus.
Defendant informs the Court that he understand his rights and waives his right to waive extradition.

Defendant signs the Waiver of Extradition in front of the Court.
The Court finds the defendant's waiver of extradition is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently.

Court will set a review hearing within 30 days to make sure the demanding agency has picked up the defendant.
Court signs the Waiver of Extradition  paperwork.

recess: 1:33 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Review Hearing: 7/22/14 at 1:15 pm (Branch 3)
